author: Press Association
title: Northern Ireland assembly elections announced
text:
Northern Ireland Northern Ireland assembly elections announced 
Election will take place on 2 March, James Brokenshire announces, after deadline passes, triggering collapse of powersharing executive Sinn Féin brought down the executive led by Arlene Foster (pictured) and Martin McGuinness. Photograph: Peter Morrison/AP Press Association Monday 16 January 2017 17.43 GMT Last modified on Monday 16 January 2017 17.48 GMT View more sharing options Close 
Stormont assembly elections will take place on 2 March, the Northern Ireland secretary has announced. 
James Brokenshire called the poll minutes after a deadline passed that effectively triggered the collapse of the powersharing executive in Belfast. 
Brokenshire was obliged by law to set an election date after Sinn Fein brought down the institutions by refusing to replace Martin McGuinness as deputy first minister. 
McGuinness quit last week citing irreconcilable differences with his long-term Democratic Unionist partners in government. 
The deadline for Sinn Fein to re-nominate a minister passed at 5pm on Monday.
